textContent:
Hey, I came across something online that made me a little worried. I saw something that seemed like you were feeling really down, and I just want to check in. How have you been feeling lately?

It looks like you’re feeling a lot of pressure with school and everything else going on. I’m really sorry if I’ve made things feel even harder. I just want to understand what’s going on and figure out how I can support you better.

It sounds like school feels overwhelming, and video games are one of the only places where you can just be yourself and connect with your friends. That makes sense. I can see why taking that away would feel really hard.

I know I’ve been pushing for better grades because I want to see you succeed, but I’m realizing that maybe all this pressure is making things worse. I don’t want you to feel like you have to be perfect to be loved or to have time with your friends.

What you wrote made me think that maybe things have been feeling really heavy for a while. I’d love to talk about finding someone who can help, someone who’s not me or your mom—just someone who’s really good at helping with stuff like this.

I love you no matter what. You don’t have to be perfect or have all A’s to make me proud. I just want you to feel okay, and I’m here to help however I can.
